properties.name: management.endpoint.filters.cache.time-to-live
properties.description: Maximum time that a response can be cached.

properties.name: management.endpoint.filters.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable the filters endpoint.

properties.name: management.endpoint.routes.cache.time-to-live
properties.description: Maximum time that a response can be cached.

properties.name: management.endpoint.routes.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable the routes endpoint.

properties.name: zuul.add-host-header
properties.description: Flag to determine whether the proxy forwards the Host header.

properties.name: zuul.add-proxy-headers
properties.description: Flag to determine whether the proxy adds X-Forwarded-* headers.

properties.name: zuul.force-original-query-string-encoding
properties.description:
Flag to force the original query string encoding when building the backend URI in
 SimpleHostRoutingFilter. When activated, query string will be built using
 HttpServletRequest getQueryString() method instead of UriTemplate. Note that this
 flag is not used in RibbonRoutingFilter with services found via DiscoveryClient
 (like Eureka).

properties.name: zuul.ignore-security-headers
properties.description:
Flag to say that SECURITY_HEADERS are added to ignored headers if spring security is on the classpath.
 By setting ignoreSecurityHeaders to false we can switch off this default behaviour. This should be used together with
 disabling the default spring security headers
 see https://docs.spring.io/spring-security/site/docs/current/reference/html/headers.html#default-security-headers

properties.name: zuul.ignored-headers
properties.description:
Names of HTTP headers to ignore completely (i.e. leave them out of downstream
 requests and drop them from downstream responses).

properties.name: zuul.ignored-services
properties.description:
Set of service names not to consider for proxying automatically. By default all
 services in the discovery client will be proxied.

properties.name: zuul.include-debug-header
properties.description: Setting for SendResponseFilter to conditionally include X-Zuul-Debug-Header header.

properties.name: zuul.initial-stream-buffer-size
properties.description: Setting for SendResponseFilter for the initial stream buffer size.

properties.name: zuul.prefix
properties.description: A common prefix for all routes.

properties.name: zuul.remove-semicolon-content
properties.description: Flag to say that path elements past the first semicolon can be dropped.

properties.name: zuul.retryable
properties.description:
Flag for whether retry is supported by default (assuming the routes themselves
 support it).

properties.name: zuul.routes
properties.description: Map of route names to properties.

properties.name: zuul.sensitive-headers
properties.description:
List of sensitive headers that are not passed to downstream requests. Defaults to a
 "safe" set of headers that commonly contain user credentials. It's OK to remove
 those from the list if the downstream service is part of the same system as the
 proxy, so they are sharing authentication data. If using a physical URL outside
 your own domain, then generally it would be a bad idea to leak user credentials.

properties.name: zuul.servlet-path
properties.description:
Path to install Zuul as a servlet (not part of Spring MVC). The servlet is more
 memory efficient for requests with large bodies, e.g. file uploads.

properties.name: zuul.set-content-length
properties.description: Setting for SendResponseFilter to conditionally set Content-Length header.

properties.name: zuul.ssl-hostname-validation-enabled
properties.description:
Flag to say whether the hostname for ssl connections should be verified or not. Default is true.
 This should only be used in test setups!

properties.name: zuul.strip-prefix
properties.description: Flag saying whether to strip the prefix from the path before forwarding.

properties.name: zuul.trace-request-body
properties.description: Flag to say that request bodies can be traced.
